title: Project-Based Learning for Educational Research Utilizing Public Data Mining

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Emphasizing collaborative learning and self-directed research capabilities for large-scale learners in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify open data sources and systematically collect data relevant to research questions.
Learners can perform quantitative/qualitative analysis using smartphone-based tools and interpret the results.
Learners can design research that reflects ethical considerations in educational contexts (e.g., privacy protection, data bias).
Learners can propose practical solutions by connecting educational issues with open data through team-based projects.

resources: Mobile Data Analysis Tool (Google Data Studio, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
